comments.body: Have you considered the trade-offs wrt `ConcurrentHashMap`? I'm asking because `ConcurrentHashMap` is my go-to for these scenarios since it's generally faster.

I didn't use `ConcurrentHashMap` since the `computeIfAbsent` instructions say the compute function should be "short and simple" and in this class it's expensive. However, worst case it blocks with synchronized either way so can just use `ConcurrentHashMap`. I agree that's better for consistency ðŸ‘

Turns out that `ConcurrentHashMap` results in a deadlock or infinite loop at

```
"ForkJoinPool.commonPool-worker-1" #96 daemon prio=5 os_prio=31 tid=0x00007f9cec46c000 nid=0x7323 runnable [0x0000700008402000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
        at java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap.putVal(ConcurrentHashMap.java:1069)
        at java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap.put(ConcurrentHashMap.java:1006)
        at scala.meta.internal.metals.InteractiveSemanticdbs.$anonfun$compile$3(InteractiveSemanticdbs.scala:98)
```

Back to `Collections.synchronizedMap` it is then.
